website_summaries.verdict: The Harmony Touch can't justify the high price of its touch screen compared with traditional multibutton universal remotes.
pros: Sleek universal remote with beautiful-looking design
large color touch screen with custom virtual buttons and numeric keypad
Web-programmable via Windows or Mac PCs, but can edit commands without having to connect a computer
cons: Much more expensive than the superior Harmony 650
lacks dedicated forward and reverse skip keys
limited customization options for the touch screen

customer_reviews.title: Most Poorly Designed Piece of Electronics in a Decade
customer_reviews.text: Easily the most poorly designed piece of electronics in a decade. It is poorly balanced. It is sometimes hard to get it to stop fast forwarding. The touch screen is inconsistent in terms of sensitive to touch. Once programmed, it is very hard to make changes to equipment settings and it does not “learn” even after repeated manual changes to the same setting. The battery dies suddenly (though having rechargeable batteries is a nice touch). In short, a complete waste of money. It is so bad that it will be a while before I buy anything else from Logitech. An update - purchased this in October. It died in January.
customer_reviews.author: MLLombard

customer_reviews.title: nice little remote
customer_reviews.text: Works great overall, but i wish there were more "standard" features available on the remote itself rather than havingbto access them via the devices menu (i'm looking at you, skip forward button...) also, the battery life could be better, but being able to charge it using a docking station is a HUGE improvement over the older models. Overall, 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: john do'h

customer_reviews.title: A great remote!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand the bad reviews on this remote. Admittedly, I’ve had a lot of experience with Harmony products, but this remote is so easy to setup. I also paired it very quickly with my Harmony Hub. It feels good in the hand and works flawlessly. A great product, but now discontinued and replaced by the Ultimate One which is very similar.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Drucker

customer_reviews.title: I would wait to see if they design a better remote.
customer_reviews.text: The remote is poorly balanced and is difficult to use with one hand without dropping it. It would be better if it had actual number buttons on it instead of having to swipe to the "number pad" screen every time. Also the new "lock screen" function adds another step to getting to your favorites. The last complaint is that it does not always turn devices on or off when its supposed to and of course the "help" button to fix it is behind the lock screen. I would wait to see if they fix these shortfalls before purchasing a Harmony remote. The previous version of this remote they made was fantastic... but my screen broke and they stopped making it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: remotely questionable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Logitech Harmony Touch Universal Remote and set it up...BUT.. I did something wrong and it only worked partially and I could NEVER get it to function properly. I read the manual and followed it's instructions (I thought). I finally junked it and went back to the agony of picking up another remote to manage my viewing / listening time. I think it is a good product BUT just beyond my ability and interest to call the company with the setup problems.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stinnett

customer_reviews.title: Overall good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Overall you get what you pay for. It works, it’s a bit heavier than my previous Harmony remotes. There is a slight delay when pressing things on the touch screen which I don’t love. It is nice to have a rechargeable dock at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Program - Doesn't recognize new devices.
customer_reviews.text: I am a computer engineer, and this was the hardest remote I have ever programmed. It would not recognize my my 80" Sharp TV that is only 6 months old. I have had the Harmony 880 for several years, with no problems, then all of a sudden the volume control stopped working. Save yourself a big head ache and money and buy the Harmony 650, it was easy to program that even my wife (who admits she is not tech savvy) understood how to program the 650. Sure you have to put double A batteries in it, but I have an old Harmony 658 in my bedroom and only have to change the batteries every year.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Nice remote, but not necessarily an improvement over the older (cheaper) versions
customer_reviews.text: I've used a number of "universal" remotes and had the best overall luck with the Harmony units. Company has a good database of devices, and the remote has a learning function to deal with the occasional oddball. Remote has a good 'feel" to it and is comfortable in the hand. But honestly I prefer the older (880) remote - this unit has streamlined the unit and eliminated a number of "hard" buttons. I find that the older unit provided me with more flexibility without wading thru levels of touch-screen menus.
customer_reviews.author: V. fasano

customer_reviews.title: A Step Back From The Harmony One
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes a company releases the perfect product and feels he need to innovate just for the sake of innovation, resulting in a more feature rich but less useable device. Such is the case with Logitech Harmony Touch. I had the Harmony One Plus with a perfect combination of physical buttons and a useful programable touchscreen. When the I dropped and shattered the Harmony One, I found that Logitech had replaced it with this newer model. Having received the Touch, I found the One's wonderfully formatted physical layout replaced with a larger touch screen that was significantly less useful. Overall, I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: So far We love it! We had the older Logitech remote
customer_reviews.text: So far We love it! We had the older Logitech remote. The one with 2 double "A" batteries. We had to change them like once a month or so. Very annoying. Also, towards the end, the whole remote started acting up on us. So we went out & got this one. I was eyeing it for a while. And as I stated before, so far we love it! A little bit on the pricey side, but I think its worth the money. With the amount of things the remote can do for you? The ease of not having to play with like 6 remotes? & the technology behind this thing? Oh, I think its amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Just my 2 Cents
customer_reviews.text: I Just did not like anything about this remote. I have had a couple of different models of the Logitech Harmony remotes, but I can't stand this model. Would always enter channel numbers if I rolled on the remote in the bed and I had the screen locked.
customer_reviews.author: Leftwingre6785

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for an earlier Logitech Harmony remote
customer_reviews.text: When my Harmony 700 started to malfunction, I looked for a replacement among the Logitech devices. This device is (supposed to be) the new iteration of the Harmony One. The layout is cleaner, the balance is better, and the touch screen is much better than the comparable features on the older Harmony 700 (there is no touch screen). All in all, a substantial improvement. The setup was easy, interfacing with the Logitech on-line software to copy the old remote settings to the new Harmony Touch. Tweaking the settings was slightly confusing, and I'm still fine-tuning some the sequences. Overall, this is a good product, and if it lasts as long as the 700 did, will be a worthwhile expenditure overall.
customer_reviews.author: BILL O'CLOCK

customer_reviews.title: Good remote...but
customer_reviews.text: The play, ff, rewind, pause buttons need to be BELOW the display not above it. Logitech's Harmony One had those buttons right under the display and it was much more convenient. This new model moves them to the top and it is now very unfriendly. The power button is right over the rewind button and almost everytime I need to rewind I end up shutting my entire system off by mistake. Also the display has "page" swipe much like the iPhone. The problem is that you will end up swiping back to the devices menu. That just adds an extra step to get back to your favorites. Also this unit has no replaceable battery like the Harmony One does.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough for the cost
customer_reviews.text: The remote is barely satisfactory, but it truly is nothing more than a fancy remote. The biggest failing is that manually tuning a channel is painful. At least one digit will not transmit, and it is so bad that it will take at least four tries to manually tune a channel. Your best bet is to program a channel to a present on the remote so that when it fails to tune a channel, you can just touch the preset a few more times until the channel tunes.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This remote is very easy to set up using the online system. I even added some buttons myself and that's easy too. My whole family can now easily control the entertainment system consisting of a TV, Projector and screen, surround sound receiver, DVD player / recorder, TiVo, and XBox. There is really no guesswork as to what button to push to get things going. The touch screen is very high quality and very sensitive. If i had to say something against it, I would change the position of the DVD transport buttons (i.e. play, pause, rew, ffd.) You have to watch out for the OFF button right there by the rewind!
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Abilities
customer_reviews.text: Now my needs may have been a bit specific but I find the fact that you can only assign favorites to one specific "Watch TV" activity dumbfounding. If you have two displays feed by a cable box (here I have and HDMI switch that toggles a cable box, xBox and PS3), the favorites will switch your control outputs (volume, etc) to one specific display. A major ding for me. I might have been able to live with it had the channel up/down buttons been a bit crisper (press, wait, press, wait) and the touchscreen numerical keypad been easier to work with.
customer_reviews.author: UnregisteredTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: A universal that really works!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried universal remotes before and none has really provided the detailed control I want. The Harmony does. It is easy to set up (if you have the model numbers for your equipment) and the event based programming (Watch TV--Watch a Movie--Listen to Music--etc.) work very well. Only the needed components turn on and everything is set for the activity chosen. The ability to choose up to 30 channels for immediate switching is why I bought the unit (the Comcast remote being 'clunky' to use) and that works great. Beyond that, one can fully control any of the devices in your system and this remote 'knows' all the commands. This one really does work.!
customer_reviews.author: RWT

customer_reviews.title: It's no Harmony One, but it will do.
customer_reviews.text: Not as friendly as the Harmony One. I don't understand why they stopped making that one. It was perfect. The buttons are somewhat awkwardly placed in relation to the touch screen. The "Skip Ahead" feature that's actuated by sliding your finger on the touch screen is a pain in the ass.....it should have a button. The Page up and Page down should have it's own button as well. Again, pain in the ass to have it on the touch screen. At the end of the day, it does everything it's supposed to.....and it functions well. It's just not as comfortable as it's predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Borden

customer_reviews.title: Product Overkill...horrible touchscreen.
customer_reviews.text: The promise of this device is great but the touch screen is so unresponsive, I've been unable to directly select a channel the first try after 2 months of use. This device also has WAY too many screens & buried menus to be the least bit intuitive. Initial set-up was easier than past Logitech software, but "adjusting" the remote to overcome the lagginess & missed commands has been never-ending. I've spent too much time in the configuration software & digging through menus - I'm done. I should have returned this after the first week. Keep looking if you're in the market...
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Mushman

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: After searching for a decently priced Harmony One, I gave up and bought this. Coming from a harmony 900, I had serious concerns about the touch screen on this. I have big hands, and thought that i would have trouble accidentally hitting the touch screen. To my surprise, I love this remote. I have no problems with the touch screen and do not miss the physical number buttons. I find that I rarely use them in favor of the favorites buttons. The gestures are also very intuitive and simple. I actually prefer them to using the physical start/pause ff/rw buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Balance is really bad, falls out of your hand, the bottom part has batteries and top part has no weight, so cannot be held easily. There are no usable buttons in the middle of the remote where your fingers are, they are all at the bottom or top and have to stretch awkwardly to reach them. Touch screen is useless and causes one to constantly hit buttons by mistake, often going into completely other viewing modes on different tv and audio inputs.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: So so, not an upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This remote is OK but not worth the money. I have an earlier model Logitech the works just fine but frustrates my wife, and I was hopeful this would be better for her. I don't think it's any better and the touchscreen is so sensitive that I'm accidentally causing it to do things by barely breathing on it.
customer_reviews.author: BIOYA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Remote / Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup. This is the 3rd or 4th Logitech remote I have owned. I have not been disappointed by any of them. The software has gotten better and better. The latest iteration is so easy, an elementary student could set one up. The one thing it does not have is auto wakeup. When you pick it up, you have to swipe the screen. I end up having to swipe it twice. I really miss this feature as all the other remotes I have owned had this feature. Other than that, I am totally happy, so much so I bought a second one for the bedroom!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Logitech Harmony I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: Let me be clear upfront, don't buy this if you do not have technical skills.. While Logitech has made it as easy as possible to configure these remotes, it's still not for the tech-challenged. I love the product and this particular remote has been my favorite of all of theirs. It's small, has a great color touch screen and is easily configurable.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mclaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Worth the expensive price
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to understand it, but I would trade it for anything now. I have a surround sound, 60 inch3D tv, X-Box with connect, Direct TV, A remote controlled fire place, and a remote controlled light switch and was having to use six remotes. Now I only have to use my Logitech Harmony to control them all. You set it up on your computer. After it is set up, if something is messed up on the system, and a lot of my grandchildren fool with it and can mess it up pretty easy, I punch the button and the Logitech Harmony can correct the problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Logitec is good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Logitech is easy to use and simple to program it controls so many components. My only issue was touch screen placement was inconvenient for me: buttons above screen used often and would brush screen after use and often activate unwanted funtion at the time
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Functional remote with draw backs.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: 1). Drop in charger 2). Ability to configure certain things from the remote 3). Size 4). LCD screen for various options. Dislikes: 1). Button placement. Splitting up the DVR play/record/FF/RW/Stop buttons and the rest of the controls makes it a bit wonky. 2). The LCD screen should have been moved to the very top. 3). The touch screen often results in hitting the wrong feature or changing what you're watching. Good remote, I like it, but it could be re-engineered.
customer_reviews.author: W. D. Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Remote
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice remote. I've had a Harmony One for the last 3-4 years and this is a worthy replacement for my well used Harmony One. It's easy to program, and easier to use.. The buttons and interface are extremely simple and trimmed down. Having my favorites with colored icons is a very useful feature on the touch screen and adds actual function to the touch screen over the default touch screen of the Harmony One. The Harmony Touch is a well thought out, easy to program, easy to use universal remote.
customer_reviews.author: DonSutt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Touchscreen for channel select is soooooo annoying. Need 3 or 4 number input for your channel? Well good luck. It will take many attempts for it to finally work. If you choose 1800, the screen looks like u can just push the name of that channel like HBO and it will go there. Nope. U will get 180. 18. Then 80. Etc. frustrating as hell.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Ike

customer_reviews.title: Great Great Remote!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! It's a game changer in so many ways. It great simplified my entire home theater setup. It works perfectly with my DirecTV, Harman/Kardon AVR, Samsung TV (and smart hub), and my XBOX One. I would strongly recommend it for it's customizability, easy and powerful configuration app, and ease of use. Even my non-tech-savvy fiance can work this thing just like any other remote.
customer_reviews.author: D. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent universal remote
customer_reviews.text: This is a great remote. I use it in my living room for my main devices. It's easy to set up (like the other Harmony remotes that I use in my house), it looks sharp, feels well-constructed, and overall works well. I haven't had any issues with it yet. I was a little apprehensive about the touch interface, since I've encountered some pretty terrible touch interfaces over the years, but this one is pretty responsive and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: elorc

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my parents and they love it. Simple controls and much nicer than having ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my parents and they love it. Simple controls and much nicer than having 5+ remotes laying around. Light-up display makes it easy to use in the dark. The DVR controls aren't in the most intuitive place, but you get used to it. Programming was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Seanotron

customer_reviews.title: best universal remote
customer_reviews.text: i have had this remote for 2 years now and i can not say enough about this harmony remote.i had tv,u verse ,bluray player.and surround sound.when turning on the surround sound it would turn on my u verse and tv at the same time.u can turn your lights on from this remote if you have ur lighting set up for that .there is endless combos to set up with this remote
customer_reviews.author: lea popa

customer_reviews.title: Don't Move
customer_reviews.text: We've been considering getting a universal remote for years and bought this on the recommendation of a friend. There are a few issues which have made it a somewhat disappointing choice. First, you ABSOLUTELY cannot move while it turns on the various components (TV, DVR, Tuner). If you do, you will be unsuccessful. Second, since it's somewhat small (not usually a bad thing), you do find yourself pushing the wrong buttons when you're just adjusting the volume. Third, although they say not to keep it in the charger, you have no idea how long the battery stays charged and, so, when it's low you no longer have any control of your components. Good thing we kept all of our remotes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT REMOTE
customer_reviews.text: I give it a 4.5 rating, and the only reason is the placement of the "play, pause, ff, etc" buttons. They're a little inconvenient at the top. Otherwise, this remote is awesome! It's simple to program thru the myharmony website. It took all of about 15 minutes with a few tweaks to add the tv, cable box, 2 cd juke boxes, the receiver, blu ray and a dvd player. Everything worked the first time after programming. The favorite TV channels on the touch screen if my wife's favorite feature. I would recommend this to anyone needing to get rid of the multiple remotes cluttering up your coffee table!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to use
customer_reviews.text: After using the Harmony 880 Pro for 5 years and then going to this remote, I found the touch screen a pain to use. I had the remote for 3 days and I just could not get around how much of a pain the touch screen is. I have returned to remote and intend on getting the Harmony 700. All I have are 6 devices to control and that is the max amount for that particular remote. I would not recommend this remote. Pros: It looks nice Cons: Price, touch screen is a pain to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Dollarhide

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen is not for me
customer_reviews.text: The trouble with touch-screen remotes is that you have to be looking at the touch screen in order to do anything - which means you cannot just feel for the remote and do something. Traditional remotes with buttons are much better for this reason. I couldn't get used to the layout or touch screen and ended up replacing it with a different Logitech remote instead.
customer_reviews.author: thebradleyroberts

customer_reviews.title: Good Remote
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd upgrade on a Harmony remote. Prior was an 880. This is by far the best. The touch screen works perfectly, and I was able to set up my components 1st time around. (But I am familiar with the process). I really like the touch screen to make selections and set up of favorite channels. I saw some reviews that did not like the button placement, or ergonomics, this not an issue for me. Had no problem reaching all buttons holding in on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony Touch Remote
customer_reviews.text: Remote works as advertised. I wish it had more buttons like a numeric keyboard. The item works well and the battery last fairly long. But, does not remember what device is where. I've reprogrammed a couple times; but, Wife hates the remote. I understand how to use it; but, when you have an A/V Receiver that controls your A/V and a large plasma the remote forgets the A/V receiver controls the volume. Just unhappy overall and too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Patience

customer_reviews.title: where's the keypad
customer_reviews.text: It takes some getting use to. I have two Harmony Ones, that I love, and they got better with the new web site. I needed to call support for an input switching issue on the Vizio TV. Other than that it works well but I still can't figure out how to get the keypad to pop up. I put all the channels that I watch the touch screen so this is not a big deal. A hard keypad, like on the harmony one is the only fault. Customer service, while slow to reach, solved my initial input problem.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES E PARE

customer_reviews.title: Works with the Comcast Cable Box
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several universal remotes in the past and they control some features on the Sony TV, DVD, Bose sound system, etc. but they don’t control the Comcast cable box. The Harmony Touch does. I have a Comcast Motorola CATV converter and the Harmony Touch controls all the features I use on the Comcast remote. It also controls the small Comcast Digital Transport Adapter I have connected to an old Sony DVR. I have been able to replace four old remotes with the new sleek Harmony Touch. It’s a little expensive but it works with all my equipment. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Senior

customer_reviews.title: Oh man do I love this
customer_reviews.text: I got so sick of dealing with 4 or 5 different remotes. I finally took a chance and bought it. Yeah, it's not perfect, but it's pretty darn close. It is really really easy to setup, using Logitech's online/browser-based setup tool. You just need the make and model numbers of your devices. There is a bit of a learning curve, but my biggest problem is the kid or animals accidentually touching something while watching a program.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mackie

customer_reviews.title: You'll need a lot of patience getting this to work right for you.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for 5 mos. and in spite of pretty good tech support on many, many occasions it still is not right. I still have to go back to them for issues that remain, but I got so frustrated that I had to get away from it for awhile. There were numerous issues and many were resolved but a few remain. I wouldn't ever buy one again. No one needs or deserves this much aggravation in their lives.
customer_reviews.author: Rich M

customer_reviews.title: Harmony
customer_reviews.text: I had the Harmony 650 but it started to reboot a lot without even touching it. I took a chance on the higher priced model and found it to be fairly straight forward. Although I think I overlooked a command to get to the LG hdtv wi-fi and separate it from the blue-ray player. The touch screen is pretty responsive and there are settings for the signal timing for station changes. I do love the GUI interface, the station numbers are rather small but functional.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome remote !!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the logitech remote for a week now. I really like it. it was easy to install. Feeding your favorite channels and changing them on the go, as you use it is very nice feature. The website is very user friendly. THe screen is bright and easy to read. I am not sure about the battery life of the remote, but it comes with a recharge station..so no changing of AA or AAA batteries. I would have liked tactile touch on the touchscreen. ..but overall cant complain about the remote.
customer_reviews.author: davisind

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I thought
customer_reviews.text: The remote works well, and is very sleek. As an "upgrader", though, I find the whole process to be tedious as far as getting to the level of button set-up on my old remote. I think they think they're doing a good job, but they are nowhere near user-friendly in this area. I've given up on it for now, since I don't want to start using it but have a poor experience when I do. Some afternoon, I'm sure, I will have free time to play with it until it's done....
customer_reviews.author: BT4

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly- Download their software for very easy set-up wizard.
customer_reviews.text: I have the digital adapter my CATV provider now requires and that involves two remotes, this works absolutely perfectly! Download the software from their site and set-up is VERY simple, did it in just a couple of minutes. was not expecting to find my TV nor the Time Warner Cisco digital adapter but no problem. Perfect for my use, bought more.
customer_reviews.author: TFarwell

customer_reviews.title: Another great product by Logitech
customer_reviews.text: Great product- My family loves this remote! It replaced a Logitech Harmony that we've had for about 10 years... it really took a beating! Family of 5, kids now 17 and 14, but they were 7 and 4 when we first got it. Based on the performance of this model so far, I suspect it will last as long!
customer_reviews.author: brittanyonpoint

customer_reviews.title: Super easy, great for multiple purposes.
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent! Super easy to set up, has all the devices I own, some 10 years old, and is a great relief to only have to use one remote! I use this for a projector tv screening room, and it accesses all the equipment including projector, video/audio receiver, cable, netflix, computer, 2 dvds and Ipad/Iphone!! Brilliant. One touch and I can do everything. Replaced 9 different remotes! Fantastic, can't say enough.
customer_reviews.author: JPFWarren

customer_reviews.title: I probably bought the wrong one, but it works fine.
customer_reviews.text: This remote handles the electronics in our setup easily. Instead of four remotes, we now have one. Everyone in the home can and does use it. My only quibble would be that it really needs to be pointed at the receiver to work. Anything blocking the beam will prevent that. I probably should have bought the one with RF capability, although we will use this one just fine for as long as it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Delver B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works well with a few bugs
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy my harmony remote. I'm looking forward to future software updates however. I haven't quite figured out how to upgrade it to a harmony home remote yet....not even sure if its possible. I also have issues with devices that randomly stop responding to the remote which leaves me to have to retrain the remote. My wife really enjoys using this remote as well.
customer_reviews.author: RyanP

customer_reviews.title: A definite must if you have a home theater system
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth or fifth Logitech universal remotes that I have purchased and is by far the nicest. You need a computer to program the remote, but Logitech walks you through the process so simply and quickly that you'll be using the device in under 5 minutes. I have five devices to control and it took me less than a minute per device. This remote has a nice feature which allows you to program in your favorite TV channels -- a really, really nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: You need to have a computer, wifi, and internet access to program this remote.
customer_reviews.text: It took three 'younger folks' to get it programmed for us, but now is working great! We are just not computer savvy. You do need to have a computer to program this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Nurch

customer_reviews.title: i'd recommend any logitech besides this one.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this remote. The technology is fantastic, the harmony system is flawless, but the layout and the touch screen option is incredibly disappointing. I absolutely hate everything about using the touch screen. There's no room for error when it comes to channel number entry. And if the favorite doesn't register and I have to manually enter the number, it's a pain in the ass to get it right the first time before the cable box auto accepts in. I would much rather like actual number buttons. Like I said, I love the Logitech system as a whole, I just hate this particular remote.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Miller

customer_reviews.title: Lots of options and the ability to set up shortcuts to favorite channels a plus
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough, bought this to replace our previous Logitech remote that was dropped one too many times and broke. Our previous model was no longer available and these seemed comparable, but there are some issues. The touch screen alternates between excessive delays to extreme touchiness. We have sat the remote down and the channel will change randomly fairly often. Lots of options and the ability to set up shortcuts to favorite channels a plus.
customer_reviews.author: thepoorchild

customer_reviews.title: ripoff
customer_reviews.text: Could not load. Logitech access number was busy. Tried for two weeks no results. Running Microsoft 10. Programmed hit synch nothing happened. Paid Best Buy geek squad $100. If this is how Logitech supports (nothing) their products. I am reconsidering purchasing any Logitech products in the future and will never recommend Logitech in the future
customer_reviews.author: rex blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Keep Looking - Bad Layout
customer_reviews.text: 1. The buttons are all ergonomically wrong. The stuff you use the most is located at the bottom of the remote and hard to push with one hand. 2. The keys go off when the remote is sitting on the table and ghostly changes the channels. Very annoying. The volume button is so small you can easily push the adjacent buttons when not intending to with weird results. This product needs to go back to the engineers.
customer_reviews.author: Hoz

customer_reviews.title: Get this remote (only if you like expensive disappointment)
customer_reviews.text: Malfunctions frequently. Limited programable features when compared to the Harmony 1100. Locks up and becomes unusable often. The only way to reset it when it loses its marbles is to plug it into the computer with the software on it. The software isn't terrible but it isn't very good either. Its a very dissatisfying device and costs a lot of money. I recommend that you spring for a higher priced but better model or save some money and get a highly rated but less expensive device. Either way, avoid this one, it is aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great. Expensive but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was put off by the price. However, I knew that having a screen would be helpful. I did not think that I could put my TV, XBox, AT&T U-verse and 8 year old DVD player (for surround sound) remotes away. Yes I can! Programming was fast and easy (once I realized that you have to plug the remote directly into your computer NOT put the remote in the charger and plug the charger into your computer).
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Set up was easy.
customer_reviews.text: I updated my Harmony One remote and the settings easily transferred over to this one. There is a slight learning curve but the menus are intuitive and I was shortly able to navigate my way. I especially liked the fact that the icons for my favorite stations were automatically added. This was a long and drawn out process with my old Harmony One remote. So far I'm liking this remote. The only reason for four instead of five stars is the price but then they all seem fairly pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Swing and a miss!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Harmony line of remotes. I even love the touch screen app feature for the iPhone/iPad. This remote is poorly laid out. It's really just frustrating, especially if you favor the skip ahead feature for watching your DVR. The touch screen on this devise is poorly limited and some of the best buttons are strangely absent from the physical remote. Poor, poor job Logitech. Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SatanicusRex

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without it?
customer_reviews.text: I've owed this for over a year now and I couldn't imagine not having it. Programming it is easy and intuitive via your computer. They ONLY negative thing I have with this is battery life. If you forget to put it on the charger for more than a few days, it will be dead. Seems to be losing power even when not in use just sitting on the table.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M.

customer_reviews.title: pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews complaining about the buttons for DVR's I had some concerns. Well after using it for a week I can tell you that unless you have the hands of a toddler the buttons are easily accessed and the ergonomics of the remote are a million times better than the Harmony One, and I thought that was the best remote ever made. It is faster and easier to navigate than the already easiest to navigate remote that it has replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Trickyric

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, the best remote control on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great new remote!
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and feel of it. I'm a Directv user and I did have to call to get one feature added...how to switch to a Netflix or Amazon movie on my Internet ready tv. But, other than that, I thought set up was straight forward. Having had other earlier Harmony remotes, it has a ? feature that usually solves any issues you might have. I like the simpler look of it without having row after row of buttons that you don't use often, if ever.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony customer support needs serious help!
customer_reviews.text: I love the remote, when it is working. It is easy to setup and operate. However, within 20 days after receiving it and setting it up for my wife, it quit working. We narrowed it down to a defective AC adapter. You go online to retrieve the customer support number, the web page says call one number, you call that number, then it tells you to call another number. Save yourself the trouble, the secret number is 1-866-291-1505. 35 minutes into the customer service call, I still don't have a replacement AC adapter on the way, even after offering to mail them the defective adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Dab5400

customer_reviews.title: Awesome remote
customer_reviews.text: This remote is so easy program even I can do it.
customer_reviews.author: kmcken

customer_reviews.title: but this works great and the price was fair too
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical after reading some of the reviews, but this works great and the price was fair too. We had an old model (from about 6 years ago) that would no longer hold a battery charge so we got this one to replace it. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: sunnysara

customer_reviews.title: I love this remote
customer_reviews.text: I love this remote! I own an older version of harmony Logitech remote and bought this one for the touch feature. I love both remotes. This touch remote is truly universal I can control my receiver, surround sound, blue ray, cable box, tv and Xbox. Works perfectly. Love the feature of adding my favorite channels and it has many other touch features.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Very good (although a tad more finicky than Harmony One)
customer_reviews.text: Even though I copied the settings from my old Harmony One remote (the best universal remote ever made), it took some time to get everything programmed correctly, especially the "program on" delay time for the TV. I like the way everything is arranged, but I decided to give the Touch only 4 stars because the user more often than not has to touch the Screen twice to get the command to be accepted. Otherwise, it works like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: W. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Best Harmony ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Harmony 800 and then Harmony One remotes for a very long time. The Harmony Touch is a definite step forward. This remote makes programming options and controls much more flexible. Here are a couple of examples: It is now possible to add, delete and change controls from the remote, as needed. Page Up/Page Down can be controlled from Gestures or touch screen buttons; same for fast forward/reverse. This is a wonderful addition to my home entertainment system.
customer_reviews.author: The Professor

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate...
customer_reviews.text: This remote is the best Harmony to date. My husband has been buying these Harmony's for many years, always getting the newest model and handing his down. This one TOPS THEM ALL. So many cool feature, things you didn't even think were possible. Swiping motion with your finger to FF or REW. Little icons for the 50 TOP channels you watch. It's awsome and worth every dime. Amazon of course had it the cheapest.
customer_reviews.author: Palatine, IL

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: I love Harmony Remotes. It is very easy to program and use. Love the touchscreen and all of the features. With this remote you can put away all your other remotes. Once programed you can operate all of your electronics (TV, Blu-Ray, CD Player, etc.) from this one remote. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: vyk_2000

customer_reviews.title: Easily  configurable online and download all ready get set to go- Good
customer_reviews.text: Nice TV logo option for selecting u r favourite channel Just input model and brand name of u r device rest is logitech gets complete remote info Other devices also easily configurable, indivisual devices easily able to configure which input on source and destination devices and which one controls volume or channel All devices functions were found to be of scroll downlist on touch screen, eventhough it is fast It will be good that if an option of remotesfunctions display method is app like touch buttons Regards, Hdvision
customer_reviews.author: Hd vision

customer_reviews.title: 3rd. Harmony for me
customer_reviews.text: This is our 3rd Harmony and this is by far the most intuitive of all. Just takes a lot of getting used to (touching screen rather than pressing buttons). The gestures page is a little tricky so therefore I cannot rate it 5 stars. Other than that very easy to set up and took all the settings from the old harmony. It is a bit pricey but hopefully will last for many years. Would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PatK

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. Had an older harmony remote that was a bit more of a challenge to set up. This one just enter the model number of the device and that's it. It works great on all my devices and thinking of getting another one for the family room as well.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Koehler

customer_reviews.title: A little clunky, but ok
customer_reviews.text: So I've probably been spoilt by a lot touch screen products, but I found the UI a little clunky. Given that it's a wireless product (it's a remote after all), I would have thought you could use bluetooth for syncing the remote rather than needing to have a USB connection. Not only that but it's a non-standard connector, which is disappointing. The remote itself works great, and it's nice to only have one unit to control all my AV gear.
customer_reviews.author: Caoimhin Breidenbach

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and works flawlessly, but lacks simplicity.
customer_reviews.text: Everything works perfectly, but just know that you must constantly look at the remote to be able to use it. There is no memorizing key location for ease of use. Lacks somes primary hard keys and screen should be located at the top, not the middle where inadvertent touching occurs. Minor design tweaks could make this remote stellar (with everyone giving it 5 stars), but as it is, it is powerful but a bit frustrating to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jidman

customer_reviews.title: Good remote, just ensure you buy it from a reputable retailer.
customer_reviews.text: The remote we received is defective. Shortly after receiving it, the unit would not hold a charge. When placed on the charger, the screen flashes. It now will not allow the firmware to be updated when it is connected to the computer. The retailer will not replace the unit, as they state the 30-day window for returns has lapsed. If you are looking to buy this remote, buy it from a reputable retailer. When it functions properly, we like this remote. But, unfortunately, we are stuck with a defective one. I would rate this remote 5 stars if we didn't have these issues with the battery and the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Dena Jalbert

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: This thing does more than what I needed it to do. So cool to just use the one touch feature and your done.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Farris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent remote
customer_reviews.text: While not as good as the 880, Logitech continues to produce great remotes that are both loaded with capabilities and also easy to use. my 2 year old already can easily start, stop and move around her favorite recorded programs and movies... Best part is not having to teach guests how to use multiple remotes all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Fernan Peralta

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for older Logitech
customer_reviews.text: My older remote decided to cease to function, so it was go back to using a separate remote for each component of the entertainment system or get a new remote -- easy choice. Now that I've had it for a while and been able to get used to the functionality, I really like the touch screen which replaces a whole bunch of buttons, luckily it's very intuitive to use.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement to my broken Harmony 1
customer_reviews.text: After breaking the screen on my Harmony 1. I searched the Internet for a replacement. The only close item was the Harmony Touch. I read reviews about how many customers liked the old one better, but since I couldn't find one I went ahead with the Touch. Transferring my software was a breeze. All settings worked flawlessly. I own an iPhone 5 and I found the touch screen very easy to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Fred L

customer_reviews.title: The way cheaper 650 model is much better...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 3 years ago and it quit working last week. I've hated it since the day I paid too much for it. The touch screen is a huge pain in the butt. I replaced this with the much cheaper Logitech 650 and it is so much better. Save your money and get the 650.
customer_reviews.author: John D Harris

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Universal Remote!
customer_reviews.text: Had some trouble at first setting the remote up to operate with my equipment. But after calling their service center for help with my concerns, the problems were resolved! There service center stayed on the phone with me while we both worked through my problems. The thing that I liked the most is if you forget to recharge the remote and it goes dead, You first recharge the remote then go to their website, plug the remote back into your computer and it will put all of your equipment settings back on the remote. Thus avoiding the problem of setting up the remote all over again like when you first bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R Luecke

customer_reviews.title: Great remote
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars, but this refurbished one came WITHOUT an owners manual, so I had to scramble on the internet to find one. The product itself is great - easy to set up (requires computer connection and list of devices you want to control). As with anything from Logitech, this remote goes beyond others you will find.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lorenz

customer_reviews.title: Great universal remoted
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an old Harmony remote. The larger keys are well laid out and easy to use. The programming is way more extensive than on the older remotes, even though our equipment hadn't changed. I have not found operating this remote confusing to use as some other have suggested. Once you set up your favorite TV stations, it's really easy to move between them. Terrific product!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nitz

customer_reviews.title: This is a no brainer no
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying my mother easy to use Logitech changers for 10 years. She loves the all in one one touch idea. However, I tried to upgrade her to the newest and latest with this model. What a disaster out of the box. I could go on but this was an example of engineers out of control. It was over the top to NOT "easy" program, interface crashed, and dumb head stuff like the "mute" button was removed as a hard key and replaced to a soft key. So when it's really timely, like whenever you want to shut down the sound, you have to fiddle through the screens. This is a disaster of a product.
customer_reviews.author: Tomjonesstillsings

customer_reviews.title: Advanced remote technology
customer_reviews.text: I have a more complex system with an auto drop down projector/screen. The set up was mostly straightforward and handles the various component activities well. And I really like the remote's "response time" as channels change immediately v. my U-Verse remote where there's always a slight delay. I'm glad I waited til this was available and didn't buy an older model.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I had a little difficulty setting this up, i imported all my settings from my Harmony ONE remote, and none of the controls worked, so i had to delete them all and start from scratch. It's very different from setting up other remotes and can be confusing figuring out the new myharmony.com app. But eventually i got everything worked out. Battery don't seem to last very long...
customer_reviews.author: Godslayer333

customer_reviews.title: The remote died on me.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in January 28, 2013. Worked great in terms of controlling all my entertainment devices until today. It just died. None of the buttons worked. Tried to contact Logitech support. But their we site keeps asking for the serial number and part number. They don't even say where these are. Sheesh. For a $212 remote, I felt I got taken for a ride.
customer_reviews.author: Hardright

customer_reviews.title: Great but the battery is Strong as a soggy Tea bag.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product, but the battery lasts a few days. Not worth the $199 price tag. It was simple to program and it does replace the existing remotes, but it has it's limitations. I gave the remote to friends to try and figure out how to watch TV, & they all failed. No -one knew to tap the screen. It has nice features but it's still a few years away from perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Gabba Goul

customer_reviews.title: Neat solution to a common problem.
customer_reviews.text: Looks sleek and works as advertised. I'd give it a perfect rating, but it didn't have a button for me to skip back 8 seconds or skip forward 8 seconds on my DVR - which has become an integral part of my DVR show viewing. The good news is, the remote allows you to map one of the other buttons on it to serve this purpose. The bad news is, there are no blank buttons, so in order to do so you must sacrifice another button on the controller.
customer_reviews.author: ddblue0

customer_reviews.title: the smart control add on is much better when paired with ...
customer_reviews.text: purchased this to pair with the hub.. after doing so its as if it was never paired at all, severely lacking.. audio is finicky and you have to point the remote at an exact area.. the smart control add on is much better when paired with the hub although it is harder to switch between different remote modes
customer_reviews.author: Prince

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony Touch Remote
customer_reviews.text: Well I have the remote now for a little over a month and have to say I am very happy with it. Once programmed the one touch features are great. I use it for controlling a complete AV system and lighting. I have only two complaints 1. The MyHarmony and the MS Silverlight software that needs to be installed on a PC can be a little troublesome installing. It takes a little tweaking to get working correctly. You need the software to download your equipment to the remote. 2. The Play, fast forward, pause buttons on the top of the remote are in a bad location. But you can use the soft keys on the screen.
customer_reviews.author: AlJohnson

customer_reviews.title: So nice only having 1 remote to control everything
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why we didn't get this remote sooner! Game changer. So nice only having 1 remote to control everything! Easy set up and user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that stopped me from giving this 5 stars is Button location. you can not use the buttons with out hitting the touch screen and changing the feature that you are trying to control. also if you are watching a DVD the remote will not turn the volume down unless you change it to receiver. it should know what is running in each scenario and make the buttons work for each item. other than that good remote easy to use and set up
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Previous Harmony One owner, love the Touch
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described. Ergonomic and comfortable in the hand. Was hesitant due to all the negative reviews - however needed a replacement for a much loved Harmony One remote. Very happy with purchase. The layout is very different, but I will get used to it. Like all things new, you have to learn a bit at the start...but I think this was a smart choice.
customer_reviews.author: hma

customer_reviews.title: What I expect from Logitech
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth remote. I keep going back to them for they make a good remote. Granted, you have to be patient while setting up, but all in all a good product. I contacted support for I could not, for the life of me, figure out how to move codes from a former logitech remote. The rep took control and did it FOR me, a big plus in my book
customer_reviews.author: Mo Tate

customer_reviews.title: This remote could be a good buy, unfortunately the touch screen is much too ...
customer_reviews.text: This remote could be a good buy, unfortunately the touch screen is much too sensitive. I can't count the number of times I have inadvertently changed channels by putting it down or accidentally changed channels just by picking it up. Waste of money...
customer_reviews.author: Seadog

product_meta.title: Logitech Harmony Touch Universal Remote with Color Touchscreen - Black [Discontinued by Manufacturer]
feature_bullets: Intuitive color touch screen: access all your entertainment options, like watch TV or listen to music, with one touch
Customizable Channel icons: set up to 50 favorite channels on the touch screen, change channels with one Simple tap, and organize them the way you want right on the remote
Sleek, streamlined design: Sculpted, ergonomic shape and uncluttered back-lit button layout for easy navigation even in the dark
Recharging station: keeps your remote charged, ready and always in reach
Universal control of up to 15 devices: Works with 5, 000+ brands and 225, 000+ devices, including ones you add tomorrow
